channel.title: .::Linksys Router::
channel.description:
Ok, I have a Linksys router.
I have setted my Port Forward on my Router.
Application - Start - End - Protocol - IP Address - Enable VinceScape - 43594 - 43594 - Both - <My Router IP> - Check
and I saved it.
Then I went to System Properties -> Advanced -> Enviorment Variables Then added "PATH" And for the Variable I had "C:Windows\System32\;"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\" Then added "CLASSPATH" And for the Variable I had "C:\Program Files\Java\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\"
Then I've downloaded DUC and Himachi, I now have a No-IP Host "vincescape.no-ip.com"
Now What do I do? Thanks
[glow=red,2,300]Vince` [/glow]
Then this come out :|
[img]http://img19.imageshack.us/img19/1619/1ui4.png[/img] Btw, What good does Hamachi give?
Thanks
[glow=red,2,300]Vince`[/glow]

item.title: .::Linksys Router::
item.dc:creator: @Serberus7 Serberus7
item.description:
@Serberus7 wrote:

i have a lynksys rouder too you cant use a no-ip with it go to whatismyip.com and use that instead

Read full topic

item.title: .::Linksys Router::
item.dc:creator: @Vince Vince`
item.description:
@Vince wrote:

VinceScape - 43594 - 43594 - Both - - Check

My Router IP I put -> 192.168.1.[1] (The [] are Input Boxes, other digits I can’t change, only Number in the [] I can)

How do I know if I’m hosting a Source? I just open my source right?

Read full topic

item.title: .::Linksys Router::
item.dc:creator: @meiscooldude meiscooldude
item.description:
@meiscooldude wrote:

  1. (probably the most posible…) make the ip 127.0.0.1 not vincescape.no-ip.com, when YOU log into your server. (no-ip if for others)
  2. Make sure you are hosting a source…
  3. If you portforwarded No-Ip right… you don’t need Hamachi…

also… i noticed that you may have done your portforward wrong…

VinceScape - 43594 - 43594 - Both - - Check

“My Router IP” I hope you did not do your Router Ip, but your Computer’s Static Ip…

go to www.portforward.com <-- look around their … they have a thing on how to set up a static ip address…

Read full topic

item.title: .::Linksys Router::
item.dc:creator: @stevencool2 stevencool2
item.description:
@stevencool2 wrote:

hamachi is like a thing that joins u and ur m8s pcs together say if they hav hamachi u create a server and they join by putting ur hamachi pass and user in then at the top of hamachi there is a ip and is ur m8 is linked to ur hamachi u run server he types in that ip at top and he can join

Read full topic

item.title: .::Linksys Router::
item.dc:creator: @Vince Vince`
item.description:
@Vince wrote:

Ok, I have a Linksys router.

I have setted my Port Forward on my Router.

Application - Start - End - Protocol - IP Address - Enable
VinceScape - 43594 - 43594 - Both - - Check

and I saved it.

Then I went to System Properties -> Advanced -> Enviorment Variables
Then added “PATH” And for the Variable I had "C:Windows\System32;“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin”
Then added “CLASSPATH” And for the Variable I had “C:\Program Files\Java\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin”

Then I’ve downloaded DUC and Himachi, I now have a No-IP Host “vincescape.no-ip.com”

Now What do I do? Thanks

[glow=red,2,300]Vince` [/glow]

Then this come out


Btw, What good does Hamachi give?

Thanks

[glow=red,2,300]Vince`[/glow]

Read full topic
